text: Redha Malek (21 December 1931 – 29 July 2017) was an Algerian politician. He was the Prime Minister of Algeria from August 21, 1993 to April 1994. He was prime Minister in the early years of the Algerian Civil War. He did not support Islamist policies. He worked with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on a plan for financial reform. He negotiated debt relief plan with the IMF for Algeria. Malek died on 29 July 2017 in Algiers, Algeria after a long- illness at the age of 85.Décès de Redha Malek, ancien chef du gouvernement ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Prime ministers of Algeria
title: Redha Malek
